sentences: See lilledega kaetud aed lõhnab suve õied.
context: The word 'lõhnab' is the 3rd person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'lõhna', which means 'to smell'. It describes something that emits or has a particular scent. The verb can be used with various adjectives to describe different types of smells - pleasant, unpleasant, strong, faint, etc.
